      • verifyCompact

        public Jwt verifyCompact(String compact,
                         JwtValidator validator)
                  throws GeneralSecurityException
        Description copied from interface: JwtMac
        Verifies and decodes a JWT in the JWS compact serialization format.

        The JWT is validated against the rules in validator. That is, every header or claim in validator must also be present in the JWT. For example, if validator contains an iss claim, the JWT must contain an identical claim. Validation for custom claims are also supported. The JWT can contain claims or headers that are NOT in the validator. However, if the JWT contains a list of audiences, the validator must also contain an audience in the list.

        If the JWT contains timestamp claims such as exp, iat or nbf, they will also be validated. validator allows to set a clock skew, to deal with small clock differences among different machines.

        Specified by:
        verifyCompact in interface JwtMac
        Throws:
        JwtExpiredException - when the token has been expired
        JwtNotBeforeException - when the token can't be used yet
        JwtInvalidException - when the token contains an invalid claim or header
        GeneralSecurityException
